bibl.title: Letter from Benjamin C. Gruenberg to Howard A. Kelly, March 31, 1927

div1.p: Gruenberg informs Kelly of the campaign to raise funds for the Kissingers and asks to borrow photographs.

div1.head: Letter from Benjamin C. Gruenberg to Howard A. Kelly, March 31, 1927
div1.opener:

My dear Dr Kelly:
div1.p:
You will be interested in the fact that the situation of John R Kissinger
has been receiving a great deal of attention in the newspapers lately, and
that we have received a considerable sum of money for the relief of Kis-
singer and his wife without any systematic solicitation. There are en-
closed two or three newspaper clippings on the matter. These, and other
publicity, grew out of the mention of Kissinger in a sermon that was broad-
casted by Rev Harry Emerson Fosdick a couple of weeks ago.

We now have a request for some photographs that can be used in a book that
one man is writing on the yellow-fever experiment, and requests also for
pictures by magazine and newspaper writers. I wonder whether you can let
us have such pictures, lend us some of your negatives, or let us know where
any may be obtained.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Benj C Gruenberg
Managing Director BCG:MJ
